name: peppergrass
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of several plants with small, green leaves that can be eaten in salads: The salad featured herbs such as watercress, rocket, and peppergrass. Peppergrass is prized for improving the fragrance and the flavour of the stew.
a kind of fern (= a plant with leaves like feathers) whose leaves float on the surface of lakes and pools: This fishing area was once noted for its clear water and lush blooms of peppergrass. We could find no sign of the peppergrass that used to cover the bottom of the lake.
More examplesFewer examplesThe two women were out foraging for pepper grass.A team of conservationists was surveying the area for peppergrass.Before today I had not spotted any peppergrass in the lake in years.
